channel.description: By people who love charts. For people who love charts.
channel.title: I Love Charts

item.title: Yesterday, I asked you guys who the smartest person you follow...
item.description:
John Green


Joe Hanson


Hank Green


Vondell Swain


Me (Jason Oberholtzer)


Neil Gaiman


John Darnielle


The mysterious Aaron Altman

Yesterday, I asked you guys who the smartest person you follow on Tumblr is. Here is what you replied.

Those receiving more than two votes are pictured above, from the top vote-getter down, left-to-right:

  • John Green (fishingboatproceeds) 
  • Joe Hanson (joetotheizzoe)
  • Hank Green (edwardspoonhands)
  • Vondell Swain (vondell-swain)
  • Me* (joberholtzer)
  • Neil Gaiman (neil-gaiman)
  • John Darnielle (johndarnielle)
  • Aaron Altman** (inothernews)

* you shameless suck-ups

** decently difficult to find his name, really difficult to find even this picture. What a mysterious fellow!

These lovely Tumblrs all received two votes:

Meg Lanker-Simons (cognitivedissonance), Lauren Fuge (sciencesoup), (zuky), Ken (ikenbot), (kelsium), Wil Wheaton (wilwheaton), Col. Chris Hadfield (colchrishadfield), Lane Crothers (politicalprof), Kenyatta Cheese (finalbossform), Maria Popova (explore-blog), Mehreen Kasana (mehreenkasana), Josh Macdo (confusedtree)

I encourage you to follow all these wonderful people. Thank you for your recommendations, everybody!
item.dc:creator: joberholtzer

item.title: I started using Gmail in January 2005, my first year in college....
item.description: I started using Gmail in January 2005, my first year in college. It replaced the AOL account I’d been using since middle school. Before that, I shared an AOL account with my parents for a year or two. Before that, we didn’t have the Internet. I can tell you blood-curdling tales of pre-Internet. I was there. Never forget.
item.dc:creator: joberholtzer

item.title: Wooo, the intersection has happened! But sadly, my day of...
item.description:
Wooo, the intersection has happened!

But sadly, my day of running I Love Charts has come to an end =(  I’ve had a ton of fun and I hope you all liked the charts I’ve been posting!

And If you ever wanna say hi, please come on over to Invisible Bread and visit (and maybe even check out a comic or two)!  I have new comics every Tuesday and Thursday, so you have TWO chances each week to be like “Hey!  I’m from I Love Charts!” in the comments =)

Thank you, everyone!
item.dc:creator: chartistinresidence

item.title: (source: Invisible Bread) I love charts so much that I even have...
item.description:
(source: Invisible Bread)

I love charts so much that I even have a character in my webcomic that is totally obsessed with them.  Luckily, there is a graph for every situation he encounters.  He pops up every once in a while when I have the desire to include a graph in the comic.
item.dc:creator: chartistinresidence

item.title: A data visualization of one of George Takei’s viral...
item.description:
A data visualization of one of George Takei’s viral Facebook posts.  Three months of Facebook activity is covered by the video.

I like this video because it’s cool to see how a Facebook post (or any kind of post) can spread virally.  At a couple points in the video, you can see when other big content spreaders shared the post and watch the new branches shoot off.  Very cool.
item.dc:creator: chartistinresidence

item.title: Here’s an example of a graph that later turned into a...
item.description:
Here’s an example of a graph that later turned into a comic!  I spiffed up the graph for you all.  The original is very black and white and very hard to read.

Here’s the comic that evolved from the graph: Flyin’ A Kite

I hope you’re enjoying my takeover day so far!  I’m having a lot of fun =)
item.dc:creator: chartistinresidence

item.title: I loved these diagrams when I first saw them and still love them...
item.description:
I loved these diagrams when I first saw them and still love them today.  A thicker line between keys indicates greater direct movement between the pair of keys.

Read the full article about these awesome diagrams here.
item.dc:creator: chartistinresidence

item.title: I thought it would be fun to translate one of my comics into its...
item.description: I thought it would be fun to translate one of my comics into its purest form: a graph!  I actually have some comics start off as a simple graph and they slowly evolve into a full-blown comic thing!  Here’s the Invisible Bread comic that this graph is based off of.
item.dc:creator: chartistinresidence

item.title: I hope the “it’s” car makes it in! As long as...
item.description: I hope the “it’s” car makes it in!  As long as the driver cuts that turn sharp enough, I think it will be ok.
